Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PG-1 analog 3 (Synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, XXA, UCLL1c; XXD1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, pig cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (72.22%) toPG-1R: 28%, V=G: 17%, F: 11%.Chemical modification:  central proline is a D-amino acid.Activity: active against E. coli JM109 (MIC 12.5-25 ug/ml), B. subtilis BR151 (MIC 12.5 ug/ml), penicillin-resistant S.aureus 1206 (MIC >200 ug/ml), and vancomycin-resistant E. faecium A634 (MIC 12.5 ug/ml).
Literature Information.Author: Lai JR, Huck BR, Weisblum B, Gellman SH. 2002
Literature Information.Title: Design of non-cysteine-containing antimicrobial beta-hairpins: structure-activity relationship studies with linear protegrin-1 analogues.
